ContentClassification.Comments: Study Data: All fifteen contributing companies to the 1970-75 ADB Study (See SOA Table Identity 705) were able to subdivide their experience by gender. Methodology: Graduated values were developed for each attained age from 5 through 75 by application of the Whittaker-Henderson third-difference A formula with K = 8. The formula was not applied at attained ages below 5 or above 75, since each of these ages involved less than 20 claims. For attained ages 1-4, a graphic technique was used with reference to percentages of United States population accidental death rates for white male lives for the calendar years 1970-73. For attained ages 76-84, the graduated values were extended linearly to a value of 100% of the combined male-female graduated rate for attained age 84 (See SOA Table Identity 705). A 100% ratio also was used for ages 85-100, where the exposure was almost entirely on male lives. Data Transcription Errors: None. Data Certified: 07/2013
